meanings.definition: To cover or mark with chalk.
meanings.sent1: I will bechalk the sidewalk for our hopscotch game.
meanings.sent2: She likes to bechalk the blackboard before each class.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel managed to bechalk the tree trunk with white chalk.
meanings.sent4: The artist's hands were bechalked with colorful powders as she worked on her masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter filled the air as they bechalked the pavement with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: To become covered or marked with chalk.
meanings.sent1: The playground equipment will bechalked by the end of the day.
meanings.sent2: The old walls in the classroom slowly bechalk over time.
meanings.sent3: As the students cheered, the gym floor started to bechalk with white dust.
meanings.sent4: The mountain path was bechalked with a light dusting of snow.
meanings.sent5: The once clear sky began to bechalk with dark storm clouds.
